items.title: Ninja Gaiden 4 releases today, grab a copy with a FREE $10 Xbox gift card
items.summary:
The brand new Ninja Gaiden 4 has released today on (just about) all major platforms, the reviews are in, and by just about all accounts the game is more than living up to expectations. If you haven’t landed a copy but are looking to score one in the early days, Newegg is offering a nice little early launch day bonus deal on the Xbox Series X|S digital copy. Both the standard edition at $69.99 and the Deluxe Edition at $89.99 are shipping with a FREE $10 Xbox gift card right now. All you have to do is drop the game in your cart and you’ll receive the free gift card alongside the Dark Dragon Descendant Yakumo Skin. PS5 gamers are unfortunately stuck paying full price as it is still starting at $70 on the PlayStation Store and over at Amazon. 

more…

This new generation of releases goes beyond cleaning, as all these new products are aimed at providing more personalized connection for pets and their human companions. items.summary:
We just spotted a deal at Amazon that drops Cherry’s XTRFY M50 wireless gaming mouse in black down to $19.99 Prime shipped. Folks without a Prime membership can dodge the shipping fee by checking out with items worth over $35 in the cart. This is originally a $69 unit that has lately been sitting at $40. Today’s deal shaves an additional 50% off to land it $20 below its usual going rate. This is the lowest price we have tracked for this model, now 71% off its listed price. The same mouse in white, in case you’re wondering, is down to $40. Head below for more details.

Some folks were not stocked about paying $1,100+ and it sounds like Samsung will, at least for now, be abandoning the Edge form-factor, but I for one think it’s quite an impressive handset and you can now land one with a wild discount.

items.title: Grab Sharge’s modern-retro ICEMAG 2 Qi2 15W 10,000mAh power bank with active cooling at its $52 low (Reg. $70)
items.summary:
If you pop in on Sharge’s official Amazon storefront, you’ll find the brand’s ICEMAG 2 Qi2 15W 10,000mAh MagSafe Power Bank at $52.14 shipped. Usually going for $70 at full price, we saw it drop down to $53 two weeks ago during Prime Day, with it retaining a Prime-exclusive discount to $56 in the time since. We are now seeing a greater 25% markdown here today, which cuts a total $18 off the going rate to land the cost back at the all-time lowest price we have tracked, which hasn’t been seen since mid-September.

items.title: Upgrade your Tesla Model 3 or Y with iOttie’s Terus USB-C charging hub at $16 (Reg. $35)
items.summary:
iOttie Terus Tesla Model 3/Y USB-C Charging Hub

Buy for $16 (Reg. $35)

What we love

If you have a 2021 Telsa Model 3/Y or later, this USB-C charging hub is ready to upgrade your vehicle. It slots right into the existing compartment between the driver and passenger seat, making two USB-C and two USB-A ports easy to reach. Once set up, it can dish out as much as 54W of power.

items.summary:

Normally going for $2,599 when at full price since hitting the market in June, we saw this low rate first appear two weeks ago during the brand’s Prime Day Sale and continuing with the event’s extension, which ended last week. Now, with its latest sale going, Anker is giving folks another shot at the best price we have tracked, cutting $1,200 off the tag. Head below for the full lineup of this station’s bundle deals.

items.title: FTC removes Lina Khan-era posts about AI risks and open source
items.summary: One post, authored by Khan’s staff, was published on January 3, 2025, with the title “AI and the Risk of Consumer Harm.” It  noted that the FTC was “taking note of AI’s potential for real-world instances of harm — from incentivizing commercial surveillance to enabling fraud and impersonation to perpetuating illegal discrimination.”
